definition:
1. Swollen; inflated; distended; puffed up, as cattle when gorged with green food which develops gas. 2. Stale; worthless. 3. Out of breath; tired; exhausted. "Their horses much blown." Sir W. Scott. 4. Covered with the eggs and larv√¶ of flies; fly blown.

Opened; in blossom or having blossomed, as a flower. Shak.
